itemListElement.name: Vegan Khandvi- Chickpea Roll ups stuffed with Kale and Cilantro. Glutenfree Recipe

@graph.name: Vegan Khandvi- Chickpea Roll ups stuffed with Kale and Cilantro.
@graph.description: Glutenfree Recipe This vegan khandvi is a simple recipe. Chickpea flour batter is set to form wide noodles, which are rolled up, spiced and served.
recipeIngredient: 2 Tablespoons So Delicious plain Greek yogurt + 1/2 cup water
1/4 teaspoon green chili paste or chili/cayenne powder
1 teaspoon organic canola or virgin coconut oil
2 teaspoons organic canola or virgin coconut oil
1  green chili finely chopped or to taste
2-3 Tablespoons Finely Chopped Kale and Cilantro

recipeInstructions.text: Mix all the batter ingredients, except oil to make a lump free batter. Blend it using a hand blender or a regular blender if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix all the batter ingredients, except oil to make a lump free batter. Blend it using a hand blender or a regular blender if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a teaspoon of oil in a medium pan, Add the batter and cook on low heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a teaspoon of oil in a medium pan, Add the batter and cook on low heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir continuously and evenly to avoid lumps. Cook till the mixture does not taste raw and thickens to slight gel like consistency. (4-6 minutes depending on the pan)
recipeInstructions.name: Stir continuously and evenly to avoid lumps. Cook till the mixture does not taste raw and thickens to slight gel like consistency. (4-6 minutes depending on the pan)

recipeInstructions.text: Drop the mixture immediately on aluminium foil and spread as thin as possible with a spatula.( 2 to 3 mm thick). Video of authentic(non-vegan) Khandvi here to get an idea of how the batter behaves.
recipeInstructions.name: Drop the mixture immediately on aluminium foil and spread as thin as possible with a spatula.( 2 to 3 mm thick). Video of authentic(non-vegan) Khandvi here to get an idea of how the batter behaves.

recipeInstructions.text: After it has completely cooled( 10 minutes), cut into 1.5 -2 inch wide strips.
recipeInstructions.name: After it has completely cooled( 10 minutes), cut into 1.5 -2 inch wide strips.

recipeInstructions.text: Oil your hands, lift one side carefully and Roll each strip into rolls, like a fruit roll up. Place some soft finely chopped Kale leaves or spinach, cilantro, or chutneys on the strip before rolling for a stuffed roll up. Place each roll up on a serving plate. You can refrigerate these for a day or 2 and temer right before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Oil your hands, lift one side carefully and Roll each strip into rolls, like a fruit roll up. Place some soft finely chopped Kale leaves or spinach, cilantro, or chutneys on the strip before rolling for a stuffed roll up. Place each roll up on a serving plate. You can refrigerate these for a day or 2 and temer right before serving.

recipeInstructions.text: For the tempering, Heat oil in a small pan. Add mustard seeds, and allow them to start popping.
recipeInstructions.name: For the tempering, Heat oil in a small pan. Add mustard seeds, and allow them to start popping.

recipeInstructions.text: Add asafoetida, and chili and cook for 15 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add asafoetida, and chili and cook for 15 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with shredded coconut, chopped cilantro and lemon juice. Serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with shredded coconut, chopped cilantro and lemon juice. Serve.
